div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 352 Hierapytna (mod. Hierapetra), Crete, (433) 1933? Burial: 44-42 B.C. (Raven) Contents: 360+ AR Athens: 50-55 New Style tetradr. 1 New Style dr. (L) Achaean League: 1 triob. (L) Cnossus: 11 tetradr. ANS 1944.100.40383 ANS 1944.100.40384 Cydonia: 7 tetradr ANS 1951.83.1 . Gortyna: 4 tetradr.; 1 didr.; 4 dr. ANS 1959.119.1 Hierapytna: 7 tetradr.; 13 didr. (L4); 2 dr. (L1) ANS 1967.152.369 ANS 1944.100.40621 Priansus: 1 st. Rhaucus: 1 st. Cistophori: c. 60 of Pergamum, Ephesus, Laodiceia, Apameia, Tralles (L 1 Tral- les) Roman Rep.: 200 den. (L 18) Disposition: London 26 as indicated above; Athens 74*; New York 6 (2 Cnossus of Athenian type, 2 Hierapytna of Athenian type, 1 Gortyna with "Roma" hd. ex Lockett 2566, 1 cist. Apameia); private coll. Athens 7 (New Style); cf. Schlessinger Feb. 4, 1935, 1052-5 (Hierapytna) Kambanis, BCH 1938, pp. 75-6 â€ Raven, NC 1938, pp. 133-55, illus. Thompson, Athens, pp. 516-7; NC 1962, pp. 313-4 Lewis, NC 1962, p. 283 * Two lots of coins acquired by Athens before 1940 are surely part of this hd.: 44 New Style tetradr. (chiefly the late two-magistrate issues to Thomp- son 1267) and 30 cist. (13 Pergamum to 49/8 B.C., 1 Ephesus of 69 B.C., 1 Tralles of 56/5 B.C., 12 Apameia to 51-49 B.C., 3 Laodiceia to 51/0 B.C.) See also no. 318 above
